nodes.value: Aburrido/a
Bored
Feeling weary or restless because one is unoccupied or lacks interest in one's current activity.
I get bored when there's nothing to do.
Nervioso/a
Nervous
Feeling worried, anxious, or agitated.
She felt nervous before her big presentation.
Incómodo/a
Uncomfortable
Feeling uneasy or awkward; not feeling physically or mentally at ease.
He was uncomfortable with the silence in the room.
Asombrado/a
Amazed
Greatly surprised or impressed; filled with wonder.
I was amazed by the beauty of the Grand Canyon.
Confundido/a
Confused
Unable to think clearly or understand something.
The instructions were so complex that I got confused.
Preocupado/a
Worried
Feeling anxious or troubled about actual or potential problems.
She's worried about her upcoming exam.
Solo/a
Lonely
Sad because one has no friends or company.
He felt lonely after moving to a new city.
Emocionado/a
Excited
Feeling very enthusiastic and eager.
The children were excited about their trip to the zoo.
Las redes sociales me ponen nervioso.
Social media makes me feel nervous.
Me siento incómodo compartiendo información con gente que no conozco.
I'm uncomfortable sharing information with people I don't know.
Siempre me asombra cuánta información útil se puede encontrar en las redes sociales.
I'm always amazed by how much useful information you can find on social media.
Para mí, es como una herramienta de aprendizaje.
For me, it's like a learning tool.
Estoy confundido sobre por qué las redes sociales son tan populares.
I am confused as to why social media is so popular.
Me preocupa que en realidad haga que la gente se sienta sola.
I'm worried that it actually makes people feel lonely.
En lugar de tener unos pocos amigos realmente buenos con quienes puedan hablar.
Instead of having a few really good friends who they can talk to.
Los jóvenes ahora tienen cientos de amigos de los que no saben nada.
Young people now have hundreds of friends who they know nothing about.
